critique: This document is an executive order that restores land in Alaska to entry under public-land laws. It removes these lands from the Chugach and Tongass National Forests. This action could be seen as favoring private interests and development over conservation, which aligns with a conservative viewpoint. There is no mention of immigration, civil liberties, or social inclusion. The action could be seen as slightly decreasing federal control by allowing private individuals to claim the land. It could also be seen as deregulation by opening up land for private use. There is no indication of expanding executive power.
